With the right wing, Buccelin assumed the spoil of Campania, Lucania, and Bruttium: with the left, Lothaire accepted the plunder of Apulia and Calabria. They followed the coast os the Mediterranean and the Hadriatic, as far as Rhegium and Otranto‚ and the extreme lands of Italy were the term of their destruCtiVe progress. The Franks, who were Christi-ans and Catholics, contented themselves with simple pillage and occasional murder. But the churches which their piety had spared, were stripped by the sacrilegious hands of the Alamanni, who sacrificed horses heads to their native deities of the woods and rivers⁴⁹t they melted or profaned the consecrated veffels, and the ruins of shrines and altars were stained with the blood of the faithful. The strength of their armies was already wasted by the change of climate and contagion of disease: the Ger- mans revelled in the vintage of Italy3 and their own intemperance avenged in some degree the miseries of a defenceless people.
